outcome:
Sustained Cure Rate (SCR) in the Modified Intent-to-treat Population -  Sustained Cure is defined for each subject having Clinical 
Cure and no recurrence. SCR is the percentage of subjects with Sustained
 Cure. The main analysis is performed on the modified intent-to-treat 
set (mITT).

dosage.comment: staggered age dependent dose, recorded >6 years dosage
outcome: Percentage of Participants With Confirmed Clinical Response (CCR) at End of Treatment (EOT) +2 Days
conclusion.method: Adjusted difference of CCR at EOT + 2 Days. Adjusted treatment difference of proportions was calculated using a stratified Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) method. Newcombe 95% confidence intervals (CIs) presented for adjusted treatment difference.

dosage.comment: staggered age dependent dose, recorded >6 years dosage
outcome: Percentage of Participants With Confirmed Clinical Response (CCR) at End of Treatment (EOT) +2 Days

Title: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation for Relapsing Clostridium Difficile Infection
Age.Description: 18 Years to 99 Years Â (Adult, Older Adult)

dosage.comment: staggered age dependent dose, recorded >6 years dosage
outcome: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Clinical Response (SCR) at EOT +9 Days
conclusion.method: Adjusted difference of SCR at EOT +9 days. Adjusted treatment difference of proportions was calculated using a stratified CMH method. Newcombe 95% CIs presented for adjusted treatment difference.
Title: A Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Fidaxomicin (Oral Suspension or Tablets) and Vancomycin (Oral Liquid or Capsules) in Pediatric Subjects With Clostridium Difficile-associated Diarrhea (CDAD)
Age.Description: up to 17 Years Â (Child)

dosage.comment: 1 day gap + 200 mg QD for 18 days
outcome: sustained clinical cure 30 days after end of treatment
Title: A Phase IIIB/IV Study to Compare the Efficacy of Vancomycin Therapy to Extended Duration of Fidaxomicin Therapy in the Clinical Cure of Clostridium Difficile Infection (CDI) in an Older Population
Age.Description: 60 Years and older Â (Adult, Older Adult)

outcome: Global cure at end of treatment
conclusion.method: with a treatment difference of 1.2% (95% CI11.3e13.7).The lower limit of the 95% CI for this difference was not above thenon-inferiority margin of10%
